citations.narrative:
- On July 11, 2024 the only llama at the facility, that was acquired on October 3, 2023, got its head stuck in a gap between
the gate and the wall of the primary enclosure and died.
- The primary enclosure housing two foxes, Kit and Kat, has an area of exposed dig barrier fence that has sharp points
and has been dug underneath the barrier which could cause a foot or leg to become entrapped causing injury. Another
fox enclosure housing two foxes, between the hay/straw barn and the enclosure with two cows, also has the dig barrier
exposed. This area is directly in front of an igloo shelter and could also cause injury if a fox were to get a foot or leg
caught.
Inadequate facility construction for the animal being housed in enclosure can lead to injury or death. Lack of facility
maintenance can also lead to injury.
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury and to contain the animals.
To be corrected by December 9, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
- On July 11, 2024 the only llama at the facility, that was acquired on October 3, 2023, got its head stuck in a gap between 
the gate and the wall of the primary enclosure and died. 
- The primary enclosure housing two foxes, Kit and Kat, has an area of exposed dig barrier fence that has sharp points 
and has been dug underneath the barrier which could cause a foot or leg to become entrapped causing injury. Another 
fox enclosure housing two foxes, between the hay/straw barn and the enclosure with two cows, also has the dig barrier 
exposed. This area is directly in front of an igloo shelter and could also cause injury if a fox were to get a foot or leg 
caught. 
Inadequate facility construction for the animal being housed in enclosure can lead to injury or death. Lack of facility 
maintenance can also lead to injury. 
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor 
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals 
from injury and to contain the animals. 
To be corrected by December 9, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
